IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE SCHOOL'S PRIMARY EXEMPT PURPOSE IS TO OFFER A QUALITY EDUCATION TO GIRSL IN GRADES K-12.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE SCHOOL'S PRIMARY EXEMPT PURPOSE IS TO OFFER A QUALITY EDUCATION TO GIRLS IN GRADES K-12.
IRS990.Description: THE SCHOOL MEETS THE EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF APPROXIMATELY 520 GIRLS FROM KINDERGARTEN THROUGH 12TH GRADE THROUGH AN EDUCATIONAL CURRICULUM AND AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS. GRANTS ARE GIVEN BY THE SCHOOL IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS.

OtherLiabilities.Description: LIABILITY FOR INTEREST RATE SWAP AGREEMENTS

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: INTENDED USES OF THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF RESTRICTED PURPOSES AS DESIGNATED BY INDIVIDUAL DONORS. THE PURPOSES OF THESE FUNDS PRIMARILY INCLUDE SCHOLARSHIPS, FACULTY SUPPORT, AND FACILITY MAINTENANCE.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: OTHER ADJUSTMENTS TO NET ASSETS AND REVENUE
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PART XI - LINE 8 AND PART XII - LINE 1D
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: CHANGE IN FAIR VALUE OF INTEREST-RATE-SWAP AGREEMENTS - ($49,642)

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: OTHER ADJUSTMENTS TO TO REVENUE AND EXPENSES
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCH D, PART XII LINE 4B AND PART XIII LINE 4B
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: SCH D, PART XII LINE 1 - $2,664,968 FINANCIAL AID REPORTED NET OF REVENUE ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS

Income taxes: In fiscal-year 2010, the School adopted the provisions of Accounting Standards Codification ("ASC") 740-10-05 relating to accounting and reporting for uncertainty in income taxes. Because of the School's general tax-exempt status, ASC 740-10-05 has not had, and is not expected to have, a material impact on its financial statements.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: THE SCHOOL ANNUALLY PUBLISHES ITS NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY IN VARIOUS SCHOOL PUBLICATIONS IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS ADMISSIONS ASSOCIATION OF GREATER NEW YORK
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION FOR MANDATED SERVICES.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: PROCESS FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE US
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO U.S. RESIDENTS ONLY IN THE FORM OF TUITION AND TUITION RELATED ASSISTANCE BASED ON NEED. INDIVIDUAL GRANT AWARD AMOUNTS ARE CONTAINED IN EACH RESPECTIVE STUDENT'S TUITION FILE, WHICH ARE MAINTAINED IN THE SCHOOL'S FINANCE OFFICE. TOTAL SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS FOR THE FISCAL-YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010 WERE $2,664,968.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE SCHOOL'S APPLICATION FOR EXTENSION OF TIME TO FILE FOR AN EXEMPT ORGANIZATION, FORM 8868, WAS PAPER FILED.

THE SCHOOL BORROWED $12,750,000 FOR FACILITY RENOVATIONS THROUGH THE ISSUANCE OF CIVIC FACILITY REVENUE BONDS, DATED OCTOBER 24, 2002. THE ISSUANCE DATE OF THE BONDS (I.E. PRIOR TO DECEMBER 31, 2002), ELIMINATES THE SCHOOL'S NEED TO COMPLETE SCHEDULE K - "SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION ON TAX-EXEMPT BONDS."

MANAGMENT OF THE SCHOOL REVIEWS THE DRAFT FORM 990. UPON ITS SATIFACTION, THE GOVERNING BODY HAS DESIGNATED ITS AUDIT COMMITTEE WITH THE RESPONSIBLITY OF REVIEWING THE FORM 990 AND REPORTING ITS REVIEW TO THE FULL BOARD. THE APPROVED DRAFT 990 IS DISTRIBUTED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES PRIOR TO ITS FILING WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: MONITORING OF CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY. EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IS ANNUALLY REQUIRED TO SIGN AN ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF COMPLIANCE WITH THE POLICY AND REPORT ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: DETERMINATION OF THE COMPENSATION OF KEY EMPLOYEES
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: TRADITIONALLY, THE COMPENSATION OF KEY EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED BY USING DATA FROM CONSULTING FIRMS, DATA FROM THE GUILD OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS FROM OTHER NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED SCHOOLS AND THE FORM 990 OF OTHER ORGANIZATIONS.

ALL GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE MAINTAINED IN THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S OFFICE AND CAN BE MADE AVAILABLE BY THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, DIRECTOR OF FINANCE, AND DIRECTOR OF DEVELOPMENT, PRIMARILY FOR PURPOSES OF GRANT APPLICATIONS. THESE DOCUMENTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. ALL FINANCIAL RELATED INFORMATION IS ALSO AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH GUIDESTAR.ORG.
